feed_remainder: Every day, ${name} feeds each of ${his_her} ${units} chickens ${per_unit} cups of feed. In the morning, ${subject} give${verb_s} them ${given1} cups. In the afternoon, ${subject} give${verb_s} them ${given2} cups. How many cups ${does_do} ${subject} need for the final meal?

${name} has ${units} plants that each need ${per_unit} cups of water daily. ${subject} water${verb_s} them ${given1} cups in the morning and ${given2} cups at noon. How many cups are needed in the evening?
A classroom has ${units} students who each need ${per_unit} pencils. The teacher hands out ${given1} pencils first, then ${given2} more. How many pencils are still needed?
${name} needs to give ${units} dogs ${per_unit} treats each. ${subject} ${has_have} already given out ${given1} treats, then ${given2} more. How many treats are left to give?
scattered_numbers: Every day, ${name} feeds each of ${his_her} ${animals} ${cups_per} cups of mixed feed, containing seeds, vegetables and nutrients to help keep them healthy. ${subj} give${verb_s} the ${animals} their feed in three separate meals. In the morning, ${subject} give${verb_s} ${his_her} flock ${morning} cups of feed. In the afternoon, ${subject} give${verb_s} ${his_her} ${animals} another ${afternoon} cups of feed. How many cups of feed ${does_do} ${subject} need to give ${his_her} ${animals} in the final meal of the day if the size of ${name}'s flock is ${count} ${animals}?

${name} has ${count} ${animals} that each need ${cups_per} cups of feed daily. In the morning, ${subject} give${verb_s} them ${morning} cups. In the afternoon, ${subject} give${verb_s} them ${afternoon} cups. How many cups are needed in the evening meal?

Each of ${name}'s ${count} ${animals} requires ${cups_per} cups of feed per day. ${subj} ${has_have} already given ${morning} cups in the morning and ${afternoon} cups in the afternoon. How many cups remain for the final feeding?

${name} cares for ${count} ${animals}. Each one needs ${cups_per} cups of feed daily. So far today, ${subject} ${has_have} given ${morning} cups at breakfast and ${afternoon} cups at lunch. How many cups are still needed?
